alert.note: Alert for Logan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:11AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Logan County through 745 AM EDT... At 710 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Logan, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Logan, Chapmanville, Man, Chief Logan State, Holden, Amherstdale-Robinette, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Mallory, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Mount Gay, Verdunville, Chauncey, Switzer, Blair, Amherstdale-Robine, Sharples and Sarah Ann. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 21 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
